Given that you enjoyed the sound of the Johnson Family Vacation, which is a family-oriented comedy, I'd recommend "How to Train Your Dragon" and "We Bought a Zoo".

"How to Train Your Dragon" is an animated adventure where a young Viking befriends a dragon instead of hunting it, offering humor and heartwarming moments. The star-studded cast includes Gerard Butler, Kristen Wiig, and Jay Baruchel.

On the other hand, "We Bought a Zoo" is a family drama centered around a father who moves his family to renovate and reopen a struggling zoo. It features Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson, and young talent Elle Fanning in its ensemble cast. Both movies may appeal to you due to their family-centric themes.

Enjoy!

This film revolves around a group of medical researchers who discover a method to bring the dead back to life, creating an intriguing plotline that is both thought-provoking and emotional. Mark Duplass and Olivia Wilde star in this thrilling drama.

If you're looking for something a bit more action-packed with an emotional edge, I'd also suggest "X" - a film about two prostitutes who witness a murder and must evade the killer as they navigate through Sydney's streets. This movie features intense scenes and powerful performances by its talented cast.

This comedy follows a small-town sheriff on a wild chase to save a beautiful damsel in distress, with Larry the Cable Guy and Jenny McCarthy in lead roles. It's a fun, laugh-out-loud movie that could provide an enjoyable watch!

For those who enjoy contemporary drama with a touch of romance, you might also like "Why Did I Get Married?" featuring a talented ensemble cast including Janet Jackson and Tyler Perry. It delves into the trials and tribulations of marriage and personal growth. Enjoy the movies!

I'd be happy to help! If you're a fan of complex and thought-provoking narratives, I'd highly recommend "Lolita". It's an adaptation of Vladimir Nabokov's novel about a middle-aged professor who becomes infatuated with a 14-year-old girl.

On the other hand, if you prefer a contemporary tale that delves into relationships and secrets, you might enjoy "The Husband's Secret". This film follows three women whose lives unravel when one discovers a secret letter written by her husband. Both films offer unique perspectives on the themes of love, obsession, and deceit. Enjoy your viewing!
